result.execSummary:
The defendant DeAndre Keshawn Madden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Defense requests future expungement. DENIED. Court sentences defendant to serve 6 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court orders payment of all costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, due 11/9/15. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant DeAndre Keshawn Madden in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for Pre-Trial Conference. 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 5, 2015 received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report; received and filed. Will address at next scheuled hearing on May 7, 2015.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

2nd copy of Justice Point Program violation report; Drug test refusal; received and filed.  Court reviewed violation and would like to take action at this time before April 29, 2015. Awaiting contact from defense counsel to schedule bail-bond hearing. Will be addressed at next scheduled hearing. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program violation report; Drug test refusal; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant DeAndre Keshawn Madden in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record. ADA to review police reports with respect to defendant and to determine if there is a video.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. tk

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Court ordered  defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant DeAndre Keshawn Madden in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  
Defendant DeAndre Keshawn Madden in custody.  
James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37 due to co-dependant pending case.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
